# wso2apim_application_key_mapping (Resource)

Manages a WSO2 API Manager Application Keys.

## Example Usage

```typescript
// DO NOT EDIT. Code generated by 'cdktf convert' - Please report bugs at https://cdk.tf/bug
import { Construct } from "constructs";
import { Token, TerraformStack } from "cdktf";
/*
 * Provider bindings are generated by running `cdktf get`.
 * See https://cdk.tf/provider-generation for more details.
 */
import { ApplicationKeyMapping } from "./.gen/providers/wso2apim/application-key-mapping";
class MyConvertedCode extends TerraformStack {
  constructor(scope: Construct, name: string) {
    super(scope, name);
    new ApplicationKeyMapping(this, "example", {
      applicationId: Token.asString(wso2ApimApplicationExample.id),
      keyManager: Token.asString(dataWso2ApimKeyManagerExample.id),
      keyType: "PRODUCTION",
      scopes: ["default"],
      supportedGrantTypes: ["client_credentials", "password", "refresh_token"],
      validityTime: 3600,
    });
  }
}

```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `applicationId` (String) Application ID.
- `keyManager` (String) Key Manager.
- `keyType` (String) Application Key Type.
- `supportedGrantTypes` (List of String) Supported Grant Types.

### Optional

- `scopes` (List of String) Scopes.
- `validityTime` (Number) Validity Time.

### Read-Only

- `consumerKey` (String) Consumer Key.
- `consumerSecret` (String, Sensitive) Consumer Secret.
- `id` (String) Application Key Mapping ID.
- `keyState` (String) Application Key State.
- `lastUpdated` (String) Last updated timestamp.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
# Application can be imported by specifying the application id and key mapping id.
terraform import wso2apim_application_key_mapping.example 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000001,00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000002
```
